text: Hi Kyle. Here’s a screenshot:
I’ve worked in the HS CMS for over a year, daily, and I don’t see where the Body Styles are available at the page editor level. Can you point out where those are in the current alpha?

Our concern is that our clients are large corporations on enterprise-level accounts, and their templates are very tightly branded. Some of those clients retain separate agencies to handle content for particular geographic regions and languages, so there could be dozens of people handling content in a portal. This Design tab appears to allow any one of those content managers to take the entire page off-brand, with no CMS workflow to ensure review before publishing.

It would be great to tell our clients “you need to require all of your agencies to ignore that tab,” but that’s not a reasonable expectation in the real world, unfortunately.

Thanks so much for the context, Melinda. So, the body styles thing is kind of odd — they have been tucked away under this icon for a long time, but I think because they’re so hard to find, most don’t even know they exist:
(Note that these are the same styles you’re seeing, just moved to the Design tab, and reorganized slightly)
100% hear your concerns on this.

In the new CMS world, when a website is structured on a theme, the contents of this tab would entirely depend on whether or not  there are theme settings available to the page. If a theme is built without theme settings, then this tab would be entirely disabled. We’re also working on a user permission for editing those theme settings at all — meaning it would be possible for a website to have theme settings, but to block users from being able to edit them unless they have that permission/role.

But that said, that wouldn’t solve for your concerns about users having easier access to the body styles that are already available to non-themed templates. I don’t think we had considered that this change would make those much more visible, which could absolutely feel like new functionality given how much more prominence they have in the UI.
In the end, I’ll bring this up to my team right away to discuss your specific issue. I definitely wouldn’t want you to be in a rough spot because of it.
